intro: Malouetia lactiflua, commonly known as the milk tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles, followed by distinctive, woody, egg-shaped capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
